name: Whose Mic Is It Anyway - Mixed Open Mic Event
description: Whose Mic Is It Anyway?: Open Mic NightsIt’s yours!An open mic event welcoming all musicians, comedians, poets, storytellers, and more. Whether you’re a first-timer or a seasoned performer, this open mic is for you.It will be a safe space (rather, a safe stage) for you to try out your new stand-up material, to perform a poem close to your heart, or sing that song you’re not confident about. No pressure, no judgement; just a place for you to own the spotlight and give the world your best.And for our audience: come and enjoy a fun evening with some of the cities most talented artists. (See performers? We’re already cheering for you!)This event happens every alternate week, so if you can’t make it this time, you can sign up for it next time!About the host: OninthoughOften branded as a sarcastic soul and an outright cynic, Oninthough is infamous for his observational humour and satirical comedy, often coupled with political undertones and religious overtones.Oninthough was crowned "Lord of Humour" at UNMAAD 2021, IIM-Bangalore. His humour has been lauded by the likes of internationally acclaimed comedians like Craig Shoemaker, Matt Banwart, and Raj Poojara, and renowned Indian comedian Kunal Kamra. He has also been featured by DailyHunt, DNA, Times Now, Indian Express, Aaj Tak, WhatsHOT Bangalore, The Sarcastic Indian, and many other publications.He has performed for audiences across 20+ cities, 7 countries, and 3 continents. With over 75k shares across social media, his punchlines and humour jabs are amongst the most shared comedic content.

name: Malleswara Darshan heritage walk.
description: Step into the heart of one of Bangalore’s oldest suburbs as we take you on a journey through time. Join us for a captivating ‘darshan’ of the many temples and religious institutions that have shaped the soul of this neighborhood. As we walk these historic streets, we’ll unravel the origins of Malleswaram and share fascinating stories of the renowned personalities who once called it home.Discover the lesser-known Maratha connection to this locality and hear the inspiring tale of a visionary philanthropist who not only restored the sacred Kadu Malleswara Temple but also created an entire lake—an enduring gift to the community.But this walk isn’t just about the past—it’s also a reflection on the present. Witness how Kadu Malleswara has gradually transformed into "Mall-e-swarm," where heritage structures and local culture are slowly fading into history. And amidst these stories of change, we’ll take a delicious pause at an iconic eatery, savoring flavors that have stood the test of time.Join us for this immersive experience and see Malleswaram like never before!

organizer.description: Heritage, food & architectural walks in Bangalore.

name: Once upon a time in Chamarajpet.
description: This is a heritage walk to the first extension to Bengaluru city by the Maharaja of Mysore. This locality was named after a famous Wodeyor ruler & was home to many famous personalities whom we will tell you about on this walk.This area was one of the first in India to have a grid iron plan and was once lined with tree lined avenues. Probably the first layout to also have main & cross roads too. It has many famous hostels restaurants hospitalschurches temples educational institutes and old homes which we intend to tell more about to you.So if you are free this weekend join us on this walk. Also included is breakfast at a legendary outlet in this area.

name: Dialogues with Books: A Mystery Awaits
description: Join Bangalore`s Iconic Book Community - Monthly DWB Meetup! 📚Join Dialogues with Books (DWB) for our monthly gathering where fellow bibliophiles come together to celebrate the joy of reading!What We`ll Do -Come with a book you`ve been enjoying lately - any genre welcome! We`ll all share what we`re reading, why it resonates with us, and dive into lively discussions about the stories and ideas that captivate us. Feel free to read favourite passages aloud and discover your next great read through fellow bibliophiles` recommendations.Expect an evening of engaging book conversations over warm beverages, light snacks, and great company!About DWB - Dialogues with Books is one of Bangalore`s oldest book communities, creating a vibrant, inclusive space where literature lovers share their passion and form lasting friendships through books. Whether you`re a seasoned reader or looking to reconnect with reading, you`ll find a warm welcome here.DWB is Perfect For: Book enthusiasts, readers wanting to discover new genres, and anyone seeking thoughtful literary conversations in Bangalore`s vibrant reading community.Location: Dialogues KoramangalaMeet Your Host: Bharat - Bharat is an avid reader, writer, and passionate bibliophile with eclectic literary tastes spanning classics, fiction, philosophy, poetry, and self-improvement. His favorite authors include Hemingway, Murakami, Mishima, P.G. Wodehouse, and Edgar Allan Poe. His infectious enthusiasm for books and skill at facilitating discussions makes every meetup both stimulating and enjoyable.

name: The Bohra Thaal – An Authentic Bohra Cuisine
description: Have You Ever Experienced Dining in a Traditional Bohra Thaal?If not, here’s your chance to be part of an intimate and one-of-a-kind home dining experience. Hosted in the comfort of a warm, welcoming home, this gathering brings together like-minded individuals to share a meal, exchange stories, and turn strangers into friends—all while indulging in the rich flavors of Bohra cuisine.Bohra cuisine originates from the Bohra Muslim community, with roots tracing back to Yemen before flourishing in India. Over the centuries, it has evolved into a delightful fusion of Middle Eastern, Mughlai, Gujarati, and Maharashtrian flavors, reflecting a legacy of migration, trade, and cultural influences.What makes Bohra dining truly special is its communal style—meals are served in a giant "Thaal", where 4 to 6 guests dine together, fostering a deep sense of connection, warmth, and tradition.From Finance to Flavours: My Journey into Bohra CuisineAs a Chartered Accountant, I built a career in finance, working with esteemed firms like Avendus and ASK. While finance was my profession, my true passion lay in cooking.Back in Mumbai, my home-cooked meals were always a highlight among friends and colleagues. After relocating to Bengaluru six months ago, I finally decided to follow my culinary dream, giving birth to The Bohra Thaal—a heartfelt endeavor to bring the authentic Bohra "Thaal" experience to Namma Bengaluru.Now, we invite you to be part of this journey and savor a 9-course Bohra feast—served with love, straight from our home to your plate.What to Expect?🍽️ Indulge in an authentic 9-course Bohra feast🍛 Dine the traditional way—sharing a giant Thaal with 4 to 6 guests🏡 Experience the warmth of home-style communal dining⏳ Pre-booking closes 2 days in advance"The nourishment of the body is food, while the nourishment of the soul is feeding others." — Hazrat Ali

name: Whimsical Wednesday with Improv Lore
description: Dive into the whimsical world of improvisation at our Wednesday Jams!Whether you’re a novice to theatre, a maverick on stage, or just dipping your toes into the world of unscripted performance, this Jam is designed for everyone. Our facilitators will guide you through a series of engaging improv exercises, help you explore new characters, and set up scenarios that will make your inner wit shine - all on the spot!Come as you are, leave your inhibitions at the door, and join us on this journey of endless possibility.Bring a friend, a date, or a group - our brave space is for everyone!Who are Improv Lore?We are Bangalore-based community-theatre troupe, works towards spreading the art of spontaneous storytelling & unscripted stagecraft, and rekindling the joy of being playful & whimsical. We meet on Wednesdays for Jams, and on weekends for workshops.You can follow us on Instagram at @improvlore and join our WhatsApp community.

name: Creative Writing Workshop
description: This is a personalized, one-on-one writing workshop designed for those who want to reconnect with their writing in a focused, supportive space. The workshop is structured in three parts:Part 1: Prompt-Based Self-Reflection: We`ll begin with a guided reflection exercise using carefully chosen prompts. This part helps you explore personal thoughts, emotions, and experiences through writing—an excellent practice for journaling, memoir, or emotional clarity.Part 2: Creative Fiction Exercise: In the second half, you`ll be given an on-the-spot creative writing prompt to develop a short fictional piece. This encourages spontaneity, imagination, and narrative flow.Part 3: Understanding Yourself Better Using The 2 Writing ExercisesWe conclude by collecting our thoughts and discussing what you have learnt about yourself and about each other through our pieces in the workshop. You can write in any language you`re comfortable with. This format allows for flexible pacing, open conversation, and tailored feedback (if desired).Whether you`re looking to jumpstart your writing practice, process personal experiences, or simply enjoy a quiet hours of creativity, this one-on-one session is designed to meet you where you are—no pressure, just honest expression and guided structure.About the host : Swathi is a Berlin based writer who writes short fiction in different genres. She conducts creative writing workshops that help people process various emotions through self reflection pieces and overcome writer’s block by building a fictional world in a limited time. You can follow her on Instagram @swathispeaks or read her work on Medium.

name: Ladies Lounge Brunch Bangalore
description: THIS IS A SAPPHIC/FEMME/WOMEN ONLY EVENT Ladies Lounge is a brunch event for sapphic individuals to meet and network in a safe environment. The event embraces women and sapphic non-binary individuals (21+) from diverse backgrounds and sexual orientations. You can come to chill and connect with others who share similar interests, bodies and pleasure.What we expect from you:- You follow the rules of consent - You are respectful to people across all genders, sexualities and lifestyle choices- Dress to express femininity Vetting and Payments:-Only those who pass the vetting calls will be allowed to attend our events- If you bring a friend you will get 10% off ticket price. The more friends the more discounts -Once you pass the the vetting call you will be offered a TIC Events membership which if you choose to take, will grant you a discount of 25 % off on all future online and offline events for the next 12 months-If you choose to not take the membership, you can pay the ticket amount and confirm your slot to the event-If you fail the vetting process you will need to take our sex and gender masterclass and pass a written test to gain the membership and attend the eventWe are doing this to ensure that the spaces TIC creates are completely safe for everyone. We also get a lot of responses from people for our events and end up spending a good amount of time vetting people who may or may not attend the event if they pass the vetting. The above process makes sure that we are compensated for our time and that you are serious about attending the event.

name: Mahabharata Dialogues - Epic Stories
description: Embark on a captivating journey into the legendary stories of the Mahabharata. Join us for a series of live storytelling sessions that will transport you into the fascinating world of the greatest epic ever written. Immerse yourself in that world and discover the heroic deeds, complex relationships, and moral dilemmas that have enthralled audiences for centuries.Host : Abhilash Purohit is an entrepreneur and a corporate educator.These last few years, he is stuck between two states of existence: (Re)reading the Mahabharata, and talking about the characters in it - their interactions, their aspirations, and their dilemmas.To audiences small and big, he brings the joy of the stories and the lessons within the Mahabharata. He finds and shares different perspectives of well-known stories from the world`s greatest epic.When not talking Mahabharata, he loves to geek out about coding and Urdu shayari.

name: The Analog Club
description: Step back in time at The Analog Club, an event series by the Studio by Copper + Cloves.Imagine walking into a busy cafe and seeing not a single phone, no-one taking selfies and no one around you scrolling. Disconnect from devices for 3 hours of unplugged experience—we'll have books, board games, music, crochet, and of course, food! But this isn't about structured activities or organised fun, just genuine connection and relaxation. The event will be fluid- you can dip into activities if you want, or you can just chat to new people or graze at our high tea counter!Meet new friends, sketch, or read a book in quiet solitude (without being surrounded by people lost in their phones).We will not be doing social media on our phones at the event, we will only take photos with a camera.Embrace the analog experience, slow down, and reconnect in this crazy digital age! **Strictly no devices (no laptops, ipads, and you will be asked to keep your phone in a basket or in your bag- not in your pocket and no where on a table. E-books are allowed)**Tickets are for entry, all games and art supplies, and unlimited high tea from our renowned deli counter. Do not purchase a ticket if you are unwilling to surrender your devices for 3 hours.

name: Money Matters: Aligning Wealth with What's Next
description: Why this experience?At some point, we all reach a moment where the practical parts of life—insurance, nominations, future planning—feel more urgent, yet still untouched. The files we’ve meant to sort, the conversations we’ve postponed, the details we assume we’ll deal with "soon."This session offers a soft landing into those questions. A no-judgement, no-jargon space to start sorting through the things that quietly weigh on our mind, so that the ground beneath us feels a little steadier. It’s not about having everything in place—it’s about taking one clear step at a time.What you will experience:A calm, conversational walkthrough of essential financial and legal basicsA gentle prompt to reflect: What’s one life admin task you’ve been avoiding?Shared insights and examples that normalise the confusion (you’re not alone)A practical checklist you can build on, with space for personal notesRoom to ask real-life questions—no shame, no jargonIdeal for:People feeling a quiet nudge to get their “life admin” in orderThose juggling responsibilities—personal, professional, or caregivingAnyone unsure where to begin with future planningPeople who’ve been putting off the boring-but-important stuffWhat to bring:🗂️ Your questions and unfinished to-dos (mental or written) 📒 A notebook if you’d like to take notes 🤝 A willingness to start—imperfectly, but intentionally

organizer.name: Zuva Life
organizer.description: We change—and sometimes the life around us needs to catch up. Zuva Life offers gentle spaces to pause, reflect, and reimagine what comes next. These experiences invite you to explore life’s shifts with curiosity, not pressure. A soft place to wonder, not to fix.

name: where you from: A Theatrical Poetry Experience
description: For ages 16 and abovewhere you from:So tell me, where are you from, now that you're here?Are you from earth's kernels, or a childhood lane?Are you from a summer of love, or your innate politics?Are you from where they say you're from, or have you yet to find out?Where You From?About the show:This genre-defining show offers glimpses into the changing identities of a body in continued performance. Bringing cliff notes from a decade-long practice in creating works of words, Nupur Azadi - a slam poet who emerged from Singapore - shows what is possible when meditations in movement, voicework, spoken word, and theatrical traditions come together.-65-minute, devised-solo told in fours acts, without intermission.-Multi-disciplinary and multi-media show suitable for audiences 16+.-This show is part of the A Decade of Theatrical Poetry celebration and was first shown during BLR Hubba in December 2024. It was followed by Jagriti Theatre in February 2025 and Sabha BLR in June 2025. About the artist:Nupur Azadi (she/her) is an international stage artist who creates works of words. She is a self-taught, multi-disciplinary artist who emerged from the close-knit slam poetry spaces of Singapore in 2015. Her work has been hailed as ‘urgent’ and ‘engaging’ by a global audience. In 2022 she conceptualized, wrote, produced, directed, and performed in a one-woman theatrical poetry show called ‘Live. Love. Loaf. An investigation into who gets to loiter’. Over 2022 and 2023 she performed the same across various venues in Bangalore and NALSAR, Hyderabad before taking it to Singapore and Cambodia. As a student of Voicework, and of literary pedagogies, and a continued participant in movement arts learnings, she labors over foraging a physicality to the previously textual genre of spoken word. She intertwines spoken word, theatre, music, and movement into an art form she christened Theatrical Poetry.Read reviews: "When Nupur speaks, you listen. What a performance!" -Vasu Dixit "Met so many women and their stories in one tonight" - Sal Yusuf"Found a whole new genre in this show." - Damini Gairola"Azadi at her courageous best!" - Dipankar Panth

name: Starry Nights - Art | Music | Food
description: Join us on a beautiful rooftop as the Bangalore breeze sets the mood for a chill, art-filled night. For just ₹650, you’ll get access to a variety of DIY art activity options — whether you’re into painting, crafts, or just exploring something new, we’ve got you covered. No experience needed — just come as you are.What to expect:Multiple art stations with all materials providedA snack and a beverage to satisfy your cravingsCurated music that inspires and upliftsCozy, creative vibes and a stunning rooftop settingWhether you're planning a relaxed evening with friends or looking to try something different on your own, Starry Nights is the perfect alternative to the usual cafe or bar scene. Limited spots available — book now and make your weekend sparkle!Terms and ConditionsTicket Requirement: All attendees aged 4 and above must hold a valid ticket to enter the event.Booking Fee: The ticket price includes a booking fee of ₹650, which is fully redeemable against art and craft activities at the event.Photography & Videography: Photos and videos taken during the event may be used for social media and promotional purposes. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team upon arrival.Cancellations & Refunds: Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellations or no-shows.Weather Contingency: In case of rain, the event will either be moved to indoors or cancelled. Please note, valet service is not available.

name: Overwhelm to Empowerment: A Stress Reset
description: Tired of theory-heavy stress management sessions with little or no impact?Need something practical, engaging, and truly uplifting?Join this transformative, activity-driven stress management workshop at MyBoTree, led by Meenakshi R Singh — Emotional Well-Being Consultant, Certified Happiness Life Coach, and Founder of The Uplifting Life Coach — and walk away with practical tools to calm the chaos and build clarity.✨ Exclusive Group Discounts Available — even a group of just 2 qualifies!

name: Soju & Slurp
description: Spicy. Fizzy. Loud. Warm.That’s how a Sunday afternoon should feel — and that’s exactly what Soju & Slurp delivers.Hosted from the comfort of our home in Bangalore, this is a 7-seat-only Korean dining experience for those who love discovering new flavors, meeting interesting people, and sipping on craft soju cocktails while slurping bowls of soul-warming food. Whether you come with a friend or show up solo, there’s always room at the table for good vibes.Here’s what to expect:🥢 A fully vegetarian Korean spread — thoughtfully curated and entirely homemade🍲 Tteokbokki (chewy rice cakes in a spicy sauce), braised tofu, and a medley of banchan (Korean side dishes)🍣 Kimbap rolls filled with colorful, crunchy, umami-packed ingredients🍹 Korean-style soju cocktails — light, fun, and perfectly paired with the food✨ Interactive dining — we share stories, swap bites, and maybe even a few soju-induced laughs🌿 Served in a cozy home setting where every dish, every seat, and every guest mattersWhat makes it special?Unlike dining at a restaurant, Soju & Slurp is personal and intimate. You’re not just eating — you’re experiencing a slice of Korean culture through vegetarian comfort food, warm hosting, and a space that feels like a lunch party with new friends. No repeats, no mass cooking — every batch is fresh, and every table is one-of-a-kind.📍 Location: Bangalore⏰ Time: Sunday, 12:30 PM🎟️ Spots: Only 7 seatsCome hungry. Leave happy. Maybe a little tipsy.This is KoreaToIndia’s signature experience, and we can’t wait to have you at our table!

name: Letters To Strangers
description: In a world of quick replies and seen ticks, this is a return to something slower, simpler, and more human.Join us for a casual meetup where we’ll write handwritten letters — not to friends you already know, but to strangers across the table. Through gentle prompts, you’ll write from the heart: reflections, questions, memories, or a moment captured in ink.What to Expect:📝 Prompts, not pressure. You’ll be gently guided to write.📓 Paper, Pen & Presence. We’re keeping it analogue — no digital devices.✨ Quiet company and a warm, welcoming space as you write.Come for the writing, stay for the connection.Please note: We may share photos and videos of the event on social media to celebrate the joy and courage in the room.Thank you for being part of the story.

name: The Ramen Map Pop-Up
description: Bento Bento presents: The Ramen Map – A Regional Ramen Experience by Chef AnumitraJoin us on July 19th, as Bento Bento launches The Ramen Map — a limited-time ramen-led dining experience celebrating Japan’s regional noodle culture. Curated by the acclaimed Chef Anumitra Ghosh Dastidar, the menu explores four distinct ramen styles, each rooted in a specific part of Japan and its culinary philosophy.Expect a deep dive into process, purpose, and provenance — with bowls ranging from temple-inspired vegan ramen to the rich tonkotsu classics of Hakata. This is ramen as it's meant to be: soulful, seasonal, and full of stories.🍜 The Ramen Map is here.One night. Four bowls. Four journeys across Japan.Bento Bento presents an exclusive ramen experience curated by Chef Anumitra Ghosh Dastidar, known for her fearless and deeply researched East Asian cooking. From Kyoto’s vegan temple cuisine to the street-smart brothless Mazemen, each bowl is rooted in regional tradition — and reinterpreted for the Bangalore monsoon.Each bowl on this special menu is inspired by a region of Japan and its unique ramen style. From temple kitchens to snowy alleys to post-war Tokyo innovations—every dish has a story.1. Temple Ramen – Kyoto (Vegan) 550 Rooted in the centuries-old traditions of shōjin ryōri—Buddhist temple cuisine—this is a serene, vegan ramen crafted to reflect Kyoto’s spiritual and seasonal sensitivity. The broth is layered with fermented elements, seaweed, and umami-rich ingredients, offering complexity without any animal products. A meditative, almost sacred bowl designed for Bangalore’s vegetarian community.2. Tonkotsu Ramen – Hakata, Kyushu (Pork) 550 From Japan’s southern island comes the quintessential street ramen. The tonkotsu broth, slow-simmered for hours from pork bones, is intensely creamy and collagen-rich. Topped with chashu pork, black garlic oil, and thin Hakata-style noodles, this bowl is deeply satisfying and bold—a nod to the high-energy ramen stalls of Fukuoka.3. Miso Ramen – Sapporo, Hokkaido (Chicken) 550 Cold winters demand warm bowls. This ramen, inspired by Sapporo’s classic miso version, is made with a chicken and soy base fortified with miso paste. Finished with charred corn, sautéed bean sprouts, soft-boiled egg, and grilled chicken, this comforting bowl is perfect for monsoon days in Bangalore.4. Mazemen – Kyoto x Nagoya x Chef’s Remix (Brothless) 550 Mazemen is ramen without broth but with double the intensity. Thick noodles are tossed in soy tare, chili oil, pickled vegetables, and sharp aromatics. While inspired by Kyoto’s simplicity and Nagoya’s street-savvy flair, Chef Anumitra’s version introduces her own cross-regional playfulness. A dish for those who enjoy texture and punch.SIDES & ADD-ONSTo round off the meal, Bento Bento will also offer a line-up of Japanese small plates designed to accompany the ramen bowls:Vegetarian OptionsSunomono Salad (Vegan) (350) Cucumber, carrot, wakame seaweedCorn & Radish Leaf Onigiri (380) Lightly grilled rice ballsAssorted Vegetable Tempura (480) Served with tentsuyu dipping sauceNon-Vegetarian OptionsSunomono Salad (Seafood) (480) Crabsticks, wakame, cucumber, carrotPrawn Tempura (480) Light and crisp with wasabi mayoChicken Nanban (480) Fried chicken glazed in tangy sauce, served with tartarDessertDorayaki (400) 		Classic Japanese pancake sandwich with sweet red bean filling—a nostalgic Tokyo street snackWHY THIS MATTERS NOWAs Bangalore’s food scene becomes increasingly global, ramen has emerged as a city-wide obsession. But few know the regional soul behind these bowls. The Ramen Map aims to offer context—not just carbs. It’s for eaters who care about origin, for diners seeking more than just trend.It’s also a celebration of cross-cultural cooking—of how Japanese food, when done right, can be soulful and satisfying in the Indian context.Come slurp your way through Japan.Limited seats | 📅 June 19 | Tickets: 300 each, redeemable against the final bill

description: Bento Bento presents: The Ramen Map – A Regional Ramen Experience by Chef AnumitraJoin us on July 19th, as Bento Bento launches The Ramen Map — a limited-time ramen-led dining experience celebrating Japan’s regional noodle culture. Curated by the acclaimed Chef Anumitra Ghosh Dastidar, the menu explores four distinct ramen styles, each rooted in a specific part of Japan and its culinary philosophy.Expect a deep dive into process, purpose, and provenance — with bowls ranging from temple-inspired vegan ramen to the rich tonkotsu classics of Hakata. This is ramen as it's meant to be: soulful, seasonal, and full of stories.🍜 The Ramen Map is here.One night. Four bowls. Four journeys across Japan.Bento Bento presents an exclusive ramen experience curated by Chef Anumitra Ghosh Dastidar, known for her fearless and deeply researched East Asian cooking. From Kyoto’s vegan temple cuisine to the street-smart brothless Mazemen, each bowl is rooted in regional tradition — and reinterpreted for the Bangalore monsoon.Each bowl on this special menu is inspired by a region of Japan and its unique ramen style. From temple kitchens to snowy alleys to post-war Tokyo innovations—every dish has a story.1. Temple Ramen – Kyoto (Vegan) 550 Rooted in the centuries-old traditions of shōjin ryōri—Buddhist temple cuisine—this is a serene, vegan ramen crafted to reflect Kyoto’s spiritual and seasonal sensitivity. The broth is layered with fermented elements, seaweed, and umami-rich ingredients, offering complexity without any animal products. A meditative, almost sacred bowl designed for Bangalore’s vegetarian community.2. Tonkotsu Ramen – Hakata, Kyushu (Pork) 550 From Japan’s southern island comes the quintessential street ramen. The tonkotsu broth, slow-simmered for hours from pork bones, is intensely creamy and collagen-rich. Topped with chashu pork, black garlic oil, and thin Hakata-style noodles, this bowl is deeply satisfying and bold—a nod to the high-energy ramen stalls of Fukuoka.3. Miso Ramen – Sapporo, Hokkaido (Chicken) 550 Cold winters demand warm bowls. This ramen, inspired by Sapporo’s classic miso version, is made with a chicken and soy base fortified with miso paste. Finished with charred corn, sautéed bean sprouts, soft-boiled egg, and grilled chicken, this comforting bowl is perfect for monsoon days in Bangalore.4. Mazemen – Kyoto x Nagoya x Chef’s Remix (Brothless) 550 Mazemen is ramen without broth but with double the intensity. Thick noodles are tossed in soy tare, chili oil, pickled vegetables, and sharp aromatics. While inspired by Kyoto’s simplicity and Nagoya’s street-savvy flair, Chef Anumitra’s version introduces her own cross-regional playfulness. A dish for those who enjoy texture and punch.SIDES & ADD-ONSTo round off the meal, Bento Bento will also offer a line-up of Japanese small plates designed to accompany the ramen bowls:Vegetarian OptionsSunomono Salad (Vegan) (350) Cucumber, carrot, wakame seaweedCorn & Radish Leaf Onigiri (380) Lightly grilled rice ballsAssorted Vegetable Tempura (480) Served with tentsuyu dipping sauceNon-Vegetarian OptionsSunomono Salad (Seafood) (480) Crabsticks, wakame, cucumber, carrotPrawn Tempura (480) Light and crisp with wasabi mayoChicken Nanban (480) Fried chicken glazed in tangy sauce, served with tartarDessertDorayaki (400) 		Classic Japanese pancake sandwich with sweet red bean filling—a nostalgic Tokyo street snackWHY THIS MATTERS NOWAs Bangalore’s food scene becomes increasingly global, ramen has emerged as a city-wide obsession. But few know the regional soul behind these bowls. The Ramen Map aims to offer context—not just carbs. It’s for eaters who care about origin, for diners seeking more than just trend.It’s also a celebration of cross-cultural cooking—of how Japanese food, when done right, can be soulful and satisfying in the Indian context.Come slurp your way through Japan.Limited seats | 📅 June 19 | Tickets: 300 each, redeemable against the final bill

name: Memories in Fragments: A Tribute to Chinnammu Amma
description: Memories in Fragments: A Tribute to Chinnammu Amma A Mohiniyattam Recital by Amith K.This Mohiniyattam recital by Amith K is a tribute to the hereditary dancer Thottasshery Chinnammu Amma, whose name has nearly disappeared from public memory. The pieces presented are learned from Kalamandalam Chandrika, a direct disciple of Chinnammu Amma, and are carried through the embodied memories of two women dancers.Rooted in tradition yet deeply personal, this performance honors a forgotten lineage in Mohiniyattam. It brings visibility to Chinnammu Amma’s legacy while also acknowledging the continued influence of Amith’s teachers, Nirmala Paniker and Kalamandalam Chandrika. Through this recital, Amith opens a space to reflect on the form’s history, memory, and transmission.Vocal: Rohith AneeshNattuvangam: Sreenima N P.Amith K.Amith K is a scholar, dancer, and choreographer with a PhD from Sree Sankaracharya University of Sanskrit, Kalady. His work explores the intersections of caste, culture, and history in modern Kerala, with writings on gender, dance, and society. Through Mohiniyattam, he challenges hierarchies within the art world, blending scholarship and performance.

name: Samyoga: Khayal se Kriti tak (unplugged)
description: Samyoga – Khayal Se Kriti TakA unique confluence of Hindustani and Carnatic musical traditionsSamyoga – meaning union or coming together – is an evocative musical production that intricately weaves together the rich threads of India’s two great classical traditions: Hindustani and Carnatic music. Conceptualised and presented by Dr. Radhika Joshi (Hindustani Vocal) and Manasi Prasad (Carnatic Vocal), Samyoga is a celebration of both the shared roots and the distinctive aesthetics of these traditions. This presentation of Samyoga will be an unplugged, voice-only exploration, where two voices come together, accompanied by live tanpuras to create an immersive and meditative musical experience.Traversing the expanse of Indian music, the concert explores genres ranging from the gravitas of classical forms to the devotional depth of Bhakti Sangeet, and from the emotive beauty of Thumri and Jawali to the dramatic expressiveness of Natyasangeet. Each piece is carefully curated to highlight both the convergence and divergence in approach, structure, and emotion across the two systems.Through a seamless blend of performance and narration, Samyoga offers audiences more than just a concert—it presents a musical journey, providing insights into the evolution, nuances, and interconnections between genres. Interestingly, both Radhika and Manasi are alumni of the Indian Institute of Management, Bangalore, who chose to follow their hearts into the world of music. Today, they are recognised not only as accomplished performers but also as dedicated researchers in the field of Indian music.

name: Shaping What’s Next : Mapping Your Inner Compass
description: At different points in life, we often feel pulled in many directions.The desire for freedom and independence.The longing to belong and connect.The quiet inner nudge to grow, shift, or heal.In this reflective Zuva Life experience, guided by master practitioner Ragini Rao (Infinum Growth), we’ll gently explore these three lifelong forces—Autonomy, Homonomy, and Physis—through Transactional Analysis.Ragini Rao is a Teaching and Supervising Transactional Analyst TSTA(P). She trains and supervises advanced training groups in Transactional Analysis to become Psychotherapists, Coaches and Trainers. With over 5000 hours of one-on-one and group counselling and therapy, over a span of 30 years, she has addressed problems pertaining to Relationships, Marital Issues, Depression, Grief, Low Self Esteem and Sexual, Verbal and Physical Abuse. Ragini is also a licensed workshop leader for the “Heal your Life” programs based on the philosophy of world renowned author Louise L. Hay. She conducts the Heal Your Life workshops in offline settings.Expect a mix of personal reflection, creative expression, group conversations, and playful tools that help you notice:When do I crave independence?Where do I feel most connected to others?What parts of me are ready to grow or change?This isn’t about fixing or solving anything. It’s about pausing, noticing, and gently mapping your own “tug of three.”No prior experience with Transactional Analysis needed—just bring your curiosity.

name: In Her Interest by Zerodha
description: Women have a complicated relationship with money.And it starts early.Many families shield their daughters from anything related to ‘finance’, but this well meaning protection ends up being a disservice. For when these young women step into the real world, they lack the confidence to make financial decisions - not because they’re incapable, but because they were never given information on budgeting, savings and investments.Later in life, many continue to rely on their partners for investment decisions. This dependency on others will only stop when they have the right information and toolkit to take back control.That’s is where we come in.After two 'In Her Interest' pilots we've realised that what women need is a safe, private space to talk money - where no question is too small or too basic.We launch 'In Her Interest' on Saturday, July 26th in Bangalore and will focus on one core idea for the launch:Building financial security for women.The session at WeWork 37 Cunningham, will be led by two amazing experts who truly get it.Sonia Shenoy - Business news journalist and host of 'The Money Mindset'.Hansi Mehrotra - CFA and Founder of 'The Money Hans'This session is on Owning Your Money, and the key areas we cover are:Philosophy of Money - Understand the fundamentals of money and the importance of building security before building wealth.Investing 101 - How to grow your wealth through Investing. We deep dive into the different kinds of investments aswell - fixed income, mutual funds, equity, active and passive investing and asset allocation.Session goalsSimplify money conceptsBust common financial mythsBuild your confidence in making financial decisionsNo jargon, just real talk.Note: Each session is theme based, this session is about 'Owning Your Money' - we are not talking stocks and shares.

name: Ketonese Delights
description: Curious cuisine. Real conversations. Zero small talk.Welcome to Ketonese Delights — a bold new take on dining where everything is low-carb… except the energy!At this table, strangers gather to explore a new kind of cuisine built around clean, keto-friendly bites and sugar-free cocktails — but the real flavor? That’s in the conversation. Honest, unfiltered, unexpected.No filters, no judgement — just good food, curious minds, and a chance to connect beyond the usual “so what do you do?”Whether you’re keto-curious, here for the sips, or just craving something (and someone) different — pull up a chair.New flavors. New faces. And a table full of possibilities. 🥑🍸✨

name: One-Day Escape Itinerary – 3rd August (Saturday)
description: One-Day Escape Itinerary – 3rd August (Saturday)From Marathahalli → Nandi Hills → Discovery Village → Adiyogi → Back🚐 6:00 AM – Depart from MarathahalliAssemble and leave sharp at 6:00 AMLight music, intro games on the ride to set the vibe🌄 7:30 AM – Breakfast at Nandi HillsReach Nandi Hills just after sunriseEnjoy hilltop breakfast with viewsExplore Tipu’s Drop, Amrita Sarovar, or simply relax with the misty breeze🧭 9:00 AM – Depart Nandi HillsQuick descent and head to Discovery VillageShort scenic drive (~30–40 minutes)🏕️ 10:30 AM – Day Outing at Discovery VillageSpend your day indulging in:Adventure activities: Zip-lining, archery, obstacle course, team gamesRelaxation: Swimming pool, hammocks, and lush greeneryIndoor games: Carrom, chess, TT, lounge zonesLunch: Buffet-style lunch with both veg & non-veg options (included)Free time to chill with new friends, play, or nap under trees🛕 5:00 PM – Depart for Adiyogi, ChikkaballapurLeave Discovery Village and drive toward Adiyogi (~1 hour journey)🌅 6:00 PM – Reach Adiyogi & Sunset ExplorationWalk around the serene space of the 112-ft Adiyogi statueExperience the spiritual ambiance as the sun dips behind the hills🎆 7:00 PM – Light & Sound Show: “Divya Darshanam”A short but immersive 14-minute 3D projection showLearn about the origins of yoga and the energy of AdiyogiSit back, breathe, and absorb the moment🚐 8:00 PM – Depart for BangaloreBegin journey back to MarathahalliLight music, reflections, and some sleepy silence🏠 9:30-10:00 PM – Arrival at MarathahalliEnd of trip with new memories and maybe some new friends too!✅ What to CarrySunglasses, cap, and sunscreenTowel & extra clothes (for pool)Reusable water bottleA light jacket for the hilltop chill

name: Mend it with Matcha
description: A joyful morning filled with matcha, mending and scrumptious food.Step into the world of Japanese traditions with Mezame’s Matcha + Workshops by Abhaa’s Kintsugi Art Experience at The Kind, a serene 2 hour journey that blends the ceremonial art of matcha with the philosophy of kintsugi: the Japanese practice of repairing broken pottery with gold, embracing flaws and imperfections as part of your story.For two special mornings, the Mezame Matcha Club founders will take over The Kind’s matcha bar, personally whisking and serving their signature ceremonial grade matcha to guests. Sip, chat and unwind amidst The Kind’s calming, sunlit interiors as you ease into the beautiful and meditative art of kintsugi.Expect great matcha, a curated spread of The Kind’s small plates and a takeaway piece that holds your own story- cracked, healed and beautiful.Whether you're here for the craft, the community or just a good cup of matcha — this one’s made for you.
